Posts.Content: Well here is my story so far- had the nerve-sparing robotic Da Vinci surgery back in 2010 after the Doc found a small lump on the prostate. Gleason 9 pre-surgery with a psa of 6.0 and upgraded to Gleason 10 post-surgery. Had 39 EBRT treatments 6 weeks later and psa dropped to 0.30. Also had a 6 month shot of Eligard and worked for a while and then of course psa gradually rose and then was switched to Lupron shots every 6 months until the psa rose to 3.5 and then doubled in one month. Could still perform with the help of Cialis but that is gone now and have metastasis to the spine in a couple of places.At that time was put on Zytiga and that has worked for 7 months and now psa is rising again. Also have been taking Xgeva for strengthening the bones and now am waiting on approval for Xtandi. The fear of my mortality bothers me but must persevere and go through the hoops of treatment, so to speak. Searched through some of your stories and was wondering if anyone has tried some of the new so-called specific targeted chemotherapies that are starting to come out of trials!
Posts.Title: stubborn prostate cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Fairwind, I am 55 years old. Currently I am on the zytiga with prednisone, along with the Lupron. The doc is very confident the insurance will approve the Xtandi and he just told me about the progress made with Provenge and we will use that if necessary. I do take vit. c and also lots of calcium and vit. d and concentrated pomegranate. I do believe the theory that " the cure is in the cause" and that cancers are directly related to our diet and lifestyle and have tried (rather weakly, I confess!) to make changes in these areas. Thank you for replying and I will keep updating about my journey!

Posts.Title: stubborn prostate cancer

Posts.Content: Hi George- thanks for your post and hope things are going well for you. I will definitely keep posting as I learn more- I will be seeing the doc on Jan. 29th and will hopefully become more educated. Pretty sure I will start the Xtandi that week. I think the Xgeva has helped with bone pain and will talk to the doc about spot radiation if pain increases again. Might have to find better hobbies than extreme 4 wheeling also lol! Last August the bone scans and ct scans showed entire cancer involvement of T 11 and partial involvement of T 10 and T 6 and minimum involvement in the lower sacrum in the pelvic area. Take care and will keep listening and posting!!

Posts.Content: My doctor was of the opinion that casodex was effective as a pre-treatment to taking the Lupron and then was discontinued. I will definitely ask him about this again. He did talk to me about referring me to radiology again for direct radiation to the bone mets and will be discussing this with him at the end of January...

Posts.Title: stubborn prostate cancer

Posts.Content: I just finished several months of Zytiga and was relieved to have little or no side effects from it. I was on Lupron( Lucrin) at the same time and had the hot flashes from that. My psa began to rise and will start Xtandi in one week- will let you know how that goes!
Posts.Title: Xtandi and Zytiga

Posts.Content: I just finished several months of Zytiga and was relieved to have little or no side effects from it. I was on Lupron( Lucrin) at the same time and had the hot flashes from that. My psa began to rise and will start Xtandi in one week- will let you know how that goes!
Posts.Title: Xtandi and Zytiga

Posts.Content: Met with the oncologist yesterday and discussed treatment options. I started Xtandi 2 weeks ago and will get psa results on March 30th. I will continue with the 3-month Lupron shots as well- the testosterone is undetectable. I discussed combining Provenge with Xtandi and the doc. said first of all there have been poor results in general with Provenge and in my case, with bone mets and more advanced cancer, would be a waste of time. He said there has been a little improvement in patients in early stages of cancer. I realize other doctors will have a different view... I will post my psa results at the end of March!
Posts.Title: no provenge for me !!

Posts.Content: Well my journey with Xtandi was short-lived as the psa went from 5.3 on Feb. 21st. when I started the Xtandi to 9.4 on May 1st. The doctor said to forget the Xtandi and ordered a bone scan and ct scan. I will see him on May 22nd. again and he is pretty sure its time for chemotherapy, having flown through Lupron and Zytiga and Xtandi-still presently on Lupron and last month's testosterone was up to 10 after being undetectable for a few months. I will post results of the scans and keep fighting the battle!
Posts.Title: higher psa- new baseline???

Posts.Content: Perhaps I'm missing something obvious here but the oncologist had a message for me through the nurse as I was calling for the latest psa results: the 5.3 was my new "baseline". This was an increase from 2.0 just 4 weeks previous. I did just start the Xtandi today as 7 months of Zytiga had these results, starting from last May when I started the Zytiga: May psa: 8.0, June,4.0, July,1.6, August, 0.9, Sept., 0.7, Oct., 0.7, Nov.,1.0, Dec.,1.8, Jan.,2.0, and Feb.,5.3. I will ask him at next weeks' appointment what he means by a "new baseline" but thought I would just throw the question out there today! The highest psa I have ever had was the 8.0 last May. (pre-surgery psa in 2010 with a Gleason 9, upgraded to Gleason 10 post-surgery and now fighting bone mets,etc. See story under "stubborn prostate cancer") This oncologist is always incredibly up-beat and perhaps wants me to view this journey into the next phase with starting the Xtandi as a "new beginning"??? Every medication I take has been a source of great excitement for him, with stories of how long men are progressing favorably on them. But I have been getting the "average" time out of them-as far as my research has shown- and then onto the next "miracle" drug! Sorry if I'm "venting" a little-should be thankful I have not missed one day of work in a very active job and have an incredibly supportive wife and children. I am humbled by all the stories of so many of you guys on here and your perseverance! Keep up the good fight!!
Posts.Title: higher psa- new baseline???

Posts.Content: Thanks Wilde for the reply! I see you are in early stages of this battle and hope things go very well for you, with extremely low psa results from now on and the "O" club forever!

Posts.Title: higher psa- new baseline???

Posts.Content: Thanks for the reply Highlander. I'm not sure what I will be taking next but I am intrigued by what seems to be a renewed interest in " Docetaxel" combined with ADT but will learn more at the doctor visit. He did mention on the phone that there may be a couple spots in the bone that might be causing the psa rapid rise and possibly radiation to those areas could solve the problem. very curious to see the comparison of the scans taken last August and those taken a few days ago...

Posts.Title: higher psa- new baseline???

Posts.Content: Well my journey with Xtandi was short-lived as the psa went from 5.3 on Feb. 21st. when I started the Xtandi to 9.4 on May 1st. The doctor said to forget the Xtandi and ordered a bone scan and ct scan. I will see him on May 22nd. again and he is pretty sure its time for chemotherapy, having flown through Lupron and Zytiga and Xtandi-still presently on Lupron and last month's testosterone was up to 10 after being undetectable for a few months. I will post results of the scans and keep fighting the battle!

Posts.Content: Now that is sure great news Fred! Good to see a positive, happy story!
Posts.Title: One Year Later...

Posts.Content: I got up from the dinner table and forgot I had the bag on and-oh my gosh!- I only suffered the pain of that nearly pulling the line completely out that that was a one time event lol. I just wore a long tee shirt and carried that fricking bag everywhere and at dinner put it on a chair next to me. The moment I got the "okay" from the nurse to get rid of it I cut the line to deflate the balloon and pulled that sucker straight out!
